qas.question: Who decided to send British troops into Germany?

answers.text: Pitt now prepared to send troops into Germany;
the army drove off the French force detailed to oppose their landing, captured Cherbourg,

qas.question: How did the British treat Cherbourg?

answers.text: destroyed its fortifications, docks, and shipping.

context: <a0_0>Pitt now prepared to send troops into Germany;<a0_0/> and both Marlborough and Sackville, disgusted by what they perceived as the futility of the "descents", obtained commissions in that army. <a1_0>The elderly General Bligh<a1_0/> was appointed to command a new "descent", escorted by Howe. The campaign began propitiously with the Raid on <a2_0>Cherbourg<a2_0/>. Covered by naval bombardment, <a3_0>the army drove off the French force detailed to oppose their landing, captured Cherbourg,<a3_0/> and <a4_0>destroyed its fortifications, docks, and shipping.
